entry.title: Change FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl::DidCopyFrame to receive frame and metadata separately
entry.content:
Currently FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl::DidCopyFrame may receive an empty frame, which will be forwarded to FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl::MaybeDeliverFrame, where TRACE_EVENT_END for the capture event of the frame will be logged [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/viz/service/frame_sinks/video_capture/frame_sink_video_capturer_impl.cc;l=1473;drc=a0455fc90ed301766d96c0a38f2006ebf5416f3c).
Thus, if the frame copy fails, there will be no way to log a TRACE_EVENT_END for that frame. To fix that, some frame identifier, like a reference_time or whole metadata, should be always passed to DidCopyFrame(), forwarded to MaybeDeliverFrame(), and used in TRACE_EVENT_END, even if there's no frame.

entry.title: Incorrect promotion for parcel tracking
entry.content:
In Chrome on iOS, I navigated to https://pudding.cool/2024/03/teenagers/ and was presented with a promotion for tracking parcel. See the screenshot of the screen that was presented in copy.
I think the promotion should not have been offered for that page. It has nothing to do with parcel (it is a page with some neat visualisation, but is mostly a free form article).
IMO, this does not me confidence that Chrome is doing a good job when I see this promotion offered for a page that obviously does not present tracking, and thus my reaction would be to disable the feature as I would not have any confidence it would do a good job.

entry.title: [Password Manager: M3 - Migrating local passwords from Chrome to GMSCore] "we are changing how passwords are saved on this device" is displaying as expanded sheet
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 125.0.6422.3 Google play services version : 24.12 Device details : Samsung Galaxy M31S / SP1A.210812.016 OS Version : 12
Steps to reproduce : 1. Launch chrome and do not enable sync 2. Disbale #upm-local-no-migration and #upm-local-with-migration from chrome://flags and relaunch chrome 3. Go to https://rsolomkahin.github.io/autofill 4. Save a credential with any username and any password 5. Tap on submit button 6. Tap on save button on the save password? popup > observe
Observed behavior: 1. "we are changing how passwords are saved on this device" is displaying as expanded sheet
Expected behavior: 1. "we are changing how passwords are saved on this device" should display as a bottom sheet.
Freqency : 5/5
Additional comments: After clearing the data it is reproducible in Samsung Galaxy M31S / SP1A.210812.016
Good build : 125.0.6415.0 Bad build : 125.0.6416.0 Bisect range : https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/125.0.6415.0..125.0.6416.0?pretty=full&n=10000 Culprit : https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5814a62dff19f3c101721c679354f4c89b2939e

entry.title: Error during the third party cookies request (StorageAccess API)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem We're an elearning company named Mega Italia Media S.P.A (https://www.megaitaliamedia.com/) and we have to use the third party cookies PHPSESSID inside an iframe. More specifically we need to use the variable $_SESSION inside the iframe itself.
Here I leave all the steps you need to follow to reproduce the problem:
1. Navigate at the following link "https://megameet.live/it/google-test-iframe/" 2. The page starts working immediatly and you'll be able to read all the steps the code is executing 3. The iframe needs access to the third party cookies. The code verifies if the iframe has access or not. If not the "REQUEST COOKIE ACCESS" will be shown and the user needs to click on it to grant the access. 4. The code will finally tell you if all is working or if there is an error
# Problem Description After enabling the "Allow Cross-Website tracking" option in iOS's Chrome settings, the problem persists.
You can see the problem if you launch this url "https://megameet.live/it/google-test-iframe/" inside the Chrome application of an IOS iPhone or iPad. Basically at the onload of the page, the code control if there is a special $_GET param and, if is not present, a random value with the "rand()" function of PHP will be generated and assigned at $_SESSION variable. After a few seconds the page will be reloaded with the special $_GET param (that is the random value assigned before) and the code will check if the $_SESSION variable value is equal to the $_GET special param value. If that is the case, the code worked properly, otherwise the "REQUEST COOKIE ACCESS" button will be exposed and when the user click on it the requestStorageAccess() method will be called and the page will be reloaded again after a few seconds. At this point (after the access has been granted) the page should work properly, however we enter in an "infinite loop" of cookie request because the variable $_SESSION will never be accessible, so the page will continue to display the "REQUEST COOKIE ACCESS" button.
# Summary Error during the third party cookies request (StorageAccess API)
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>PermissionsAPI
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue I was able to reproduce the problem also in Firefox v. 125.0 (40715) and Opera v. 4.6.3 (1), however Edge v. 123.0.2420.90 works properly if the option "Allow Cross-Website tracking" is enabled
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Leveldb consistently corrupted when no disk space
entry.content:
When there is no disk space left, IndexedDB will consistently be corrupted. Chromium's response to a corrupted database is to reset it. So users lose all their data with no recovery attempted.
This may be reproduced when a site has been granted persistent storage, but is easier to reproduce in Electron which always grants the app persistent unlimited storage. I've produced a reproduction using [Electron Fiddle](https://www.electronjs.org/fiddle) which can load [this gist](https://gist.github.com/shadow-light/e00da7bf774f343917627b72a03e075c).
My assumption was that leveldb would preserve all existing data when a write isn't possible rather than result in a corruption of the database (and then a reset).

entry.title: Ensure a holdback feature is available for CCT-triggered prefetches
entry.content:
We need to ensure holdback groups are possible for CCT-prefetch.
To do this, we need to ensure that our Finch feature has a boolean parameter for the holdback, and it is wired up correctly to `PreloadingAttemptImpl::ShouldHoldback()`.
A sample CL doing this for a different feature is here: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5075994

entry.title: libavif BUILD.gn change broke building against system libwebp [linux]
entry.content:
Commit 3bee841885cadf584753446c705e71c3f154b517 ("libavif,BUILD.gn::libavif_enc: enable sharpyuv") added a dependency to the bundled libavif (third_party/libavif) on 'libwebp_sharpyuv'. It also added this static library definition to the bundled libwebp (third_party/libwebp). However, it did not add a similar static lib definition to the unbundled libwebp shim (build/linux/unbundle/libwebp.gn).
The result is that if you're building against the system libwebp while simultaneously using the bundled libavif, then the build fails due to a missing libwebp_sharpuv dependency. A dummy shim for that library should probably be added to build/linux/unbundle/libwebp.gn.

entry.title: Ensure UKM is correctly recorded for CCT-triggered prefetches
entry.content:
We need to ensure we are collecting sufficient UKMs for CCT-triggered prefetches.
Because the "initiator" is an Android app, we will not be able to record `Preloading.Attempt.PreviousPrimaryPage`. However, we can and should record `Preloading.Attempt`.
We need to ensure these `Preloading.Attempt`s have a custom value for their `PreloadingPredictor` field. This involves declaring a new `PreloadingPredictor`, probably in https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/preloading/chrome_preloading.h.

entry.title: Save request (or raw) size in PartitionAlloc's InSlotMetadata
entry.content:
If we extend InSlotMetadata from 4B to 8B (which we have proven to not add extra memory overhead [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fGrZhCpF0HbP3KmqVra5BDtrc3YvKk1Ymob5dLgfBjo/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.byy7gir8q9xx)), we will have enough bits to save requested/raw size.
This will be useful for features like crbug.com/41496184 and/or [WillBeSpan](https://docs.google.com/document/d/16MgsnvjhVQgzJyGOmYqLArxUKiKsIS0erIFlsGb3VfU/edit?usp=sharing).
Another use case is accurate accounting of PartitionAlloc allocations, which was useful in [this analysis](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qNG6ZrjzX6HaBf-D_ieRZpHdOcSnxSU0uV7t5bPxQjg/edit?usp=sharing), but can likely also increase accuracy of our metrics. This work has been prototyped by lizeb@ in crrev.com/c/3540324 (for local use only) but now we have an opportunity to productionize it.
Note, we have to be careful about other usages of the InSlotMetadata bits. The main one is Dangling Pointer Detector -- it runs only in CQ and crrev.com/c/5316800 shows how many bits we can steal from the ref-counts to make it still pass, but more thought needs to be given if we ever productionize DPD. MiracleObject and possibly (E-)LUD might be other users of the InSlotMetadata bits.
Note 2, crbug.com/333443437 will reduce the number of bits needed. Currently only allocations over 16 system pages have their size stored in PartitionPageMetada (at the beginning of the super page), hence not needing InSlotMetada support. That can be a high number on systems with larger system pages (currently 16kB is supported, and 64kB is being worked on). Resolving the said issue will helped with that.

entry.title: scroll-padding causes unwanted scroll on sticky elements
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open the pen: https://codepen.io/bakura10/pen/QWPVYEE 2. Scroll lower into the page. 3. Focus one of the link in the sticky bar, and you will see that the page will scroll up automatically. This only happens for sticky element. If the positioning is changed to fixed, it works as expected.
# Problem Description Hi,
A common way to have the anchor scroll works well with sticky element is to add a scroll-padding-top on the HTML to account for the sticky elements. Unfortunately, on Safari and Chrome (Firefox works as expected), this cause an unwanted scroll when using a sticky element.
Please see the attached video for more details. This issue has been cross-posted on Safari bug tracker as well (https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=272799).
# Summary scroll-padding causes unwanted scroll on sticky elements
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Investigate request-blocking APIs and the interaction with preloading
entry.content:
A sad fact is that some ad-blocking extensions, like uBlock Origin, turn off all preloading, via forcing the value of chrome://settings/performance's "Preload pages" option. This means users using such extensions are not able to see the benefits of preloading.
From what I understand reading issue 40549991, issue 40458266, and issue 41356037, at least at some point in time, some preloading technologies bypassed the network request-blocking APIs that such extensions rely on. Thus, if an extension wants to prevent all connections to https://example.com/, the only way they could do that would be by disabling preloading.
The purpose of this issue is to get a fully up-to-date view of the situation, so that maybe, eventually, we can have some way for these extensions to accomplish their goals without disabling all preloading.
In particular, we need to test:
- Speculation rules prefetch - Speculation rules prerender - `<link rel=prerender>` - `<link rel=prefetch>` - `<link rel=preload>` - `<link rel=dns-prefetch>` - `<link rel=preconnect>` - `fetch()`
each targeting a:
- same-origin destination - same-site cross-origin destination - cross-site destination
against:
- A manifest v2 extension's blocking capabilities - A manifest v3 extension's blocking capabilities - No extensions, but "preload pages" setting turned off
and see which of these technologies are blocked by which settings.
(I don't know the details on what blocking abilities manifest v2 and manifest v3 extensions have, so that might generate more test cases if they have more than one.)
The result should be a nice writeup document, containing some info on how the tests were constructed, and a table with all the results.

entry.title: QuicTestPacketMaker::Reset doesn't really "reset" the maker
entry.content:
From awillia@ in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5425361/comment/c7e55bae_5b861e11/
I know this currently just does what QuicTestPacketMaker::Reset() used to do, but with a name like Reset I'd think more members of the ConnectionState would be reset. Should it be renamed to ResetStreamOffsets? Should more data be reset? If so, maybe we can add a TODO in this CL at least? Also, a comment above the method in the .h file would be helpful.
